meanings.definition: To wrap or tie something together
meanings.sent1: She bundled the flowers with a ribbon.
meanings.sent2: The farmer bundled the hay for storage.
meanings.sent3: The cat bundled itself in a cozy blanket.
meanings.sent4: The children bundled their toys in a big box.
meanings.sent5: He bundled the papers neatly to organize them.

meanings.definition: A group of items packaged or tied together
meanings.sent1: The store offered a bundled deal on socks and gloves.
meanings.sent2: She bought a bundled set of kitchen utensils.
meanings.sent3: The bundled gift basket was full of goodies.
meanings.sent4: The hiker carried a heavy bundled of supplies.
meanings.sent5: The bundled package arrived at the doorstep.

meanings.definition: To include multiple items together for sale or distribution
meanings.sent1: The company bundled the internet and cable services.
meanings.sent2: They bundled the snacks with the drinks for the party.
meanings.sent3: The magician bundled various tricks for the show.
meanings.sent4: She bundled the books and magazines for the library.
meanings.sent5: He bundled the products to offer a discount.
